bug.short_desc: [kernel] switching to virtual console freezes graphical login screen
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: For current Fedora 26 (rawhide), switching to a virtual console freezes the graphical login screen on a Lenovo T400 with an ATI Mobility Radeon HD 3470 (RV620) video device.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): kernel-4.10.0-0.rc5.git0.1.fc26
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Boot system with current Fedora 26 (rawhide). 2. Switch from graphical login screen to a virtual console.
Actual results: The switch is not carried out, and the graphical login screen is frozen: the clock does not advance any longer, and no response to keyboard or mouse input is observed.
Expected results: System switches to the selected virtual console.
Additional info: Current Fedora 25 behaves absolutely normal in this respect.

While testing for #1417454 I stumbled over the same issue. I used a Fedora 25 with a RawhideKernelNodebug kernel [1,2] on a desktop system. I have a Radeon GPU, too [3]. The behaviour can be observed if switching to a virtual console, regardless if done from the login screen or from the desktop environment after login. If switching back to X (I'm using XFCE) everything is normal again.
[1] 4.10.0-0.rc6.git1.2.fc26.x86_64 [2] 4.10.0-0.rc6.git2.2.fc26.x86_64
[3] $ lspci|grep VGA 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. [AMD/ATI] Curacao XT / Trinidad XT [Radeon R7 370 / R9 270X/370X]
1. Issue is still present for kernel-4.11.0-0.rc2.git0.2.fc26. 2. Issue is absent for Intel GMA 950 chipset graphics.
After upgrading to kernel series 4.10.x in Fedora 25, now the latter is affected by this issue, see bug 1438215.
